pages.text: After the Buzzing Bees update, bees are now a thing in Minecraft. That's would be a problem, because if there was two bee systems, they would conflict with each other.$(br2)But don't worry, Reforested Bees is compatible with the vanilla bees, and will not conflict with them.

There was a few changes to beehives and bee nests but it should not change how vanilla bees work.$(br)Now you need to use a $(item)Scoop$() to get a bee out of a hive. You can still gather bee nest with a silk touch $(m)tool$() scoop.

Also $(item)Beehives$() have now UI, that you can't interact with, but you can peek what is happening inside. The $(item)Beehives$() are accepting one type of Entity Bee.$(br)This is because of type of honeycomb they produce. You can see the type of bee on the right of the beehive UI.$(p)To change bee type you need clean it with $(thing)Shift$() when holding an $(item)Axe$().
